page.title: 14CHURCHES IN THE AREA
page.content:
CHURCHES IN AND AROUND HELSBY
THERE ARE TWO CHURCHES ST.PAULS (ANGLICAN) AND HELSBY METHODIST CHURCH. ST.PAULS BEING THE OLDER OF THE TWO HAS APPROX. 9O COMMUNICANTS ON A SUNDAY MORNING WITH AROUND 14O ACTUAL FULL MEMBERS.THE EXISTING BUILDING OF THE METHODIST CHURCH IS 19 YEARS OLD, AND WAS BUILT TO MERGE THE THREE ORIGINAL CHAPELS IN THE VILLAGE. IT HAS AN AVERAGE MORNING CONGREGATION OF 1OO AND HAS 16O FULL MEMBERS. THE LIGHT AND LIFE FREE METHODIST CHURCH IS SITUATED BETWEEN HELSBY AND FRODSHAM. THE CHURCH ITSELF IS 5 YEARS OLD BUT THE NEW BUILDING WAS NOT OPENED UNTIL 1984. CONGREGATIONS AVERAGE 1OO WITH APPROX. 35 FULL MEMBERS.MAIN STREET CHURCH FRODSHAM HAS APPROX. 5O FULL MEMBERS.
